sentences.en: All the people here refuse credence to the story.
sentences.cn: 这儿所有的人们都不相信这番话.

sentences.en: But a recent study that adds credence to the G - spot concept.
sentences.cn: 但最近一次研究给G点的概念增加了确定性.

sentences.en: Don't give credence to all the gossip you hear.
sentences.cn: 不要相信你听到的闲话.

sentences.en: Good studies are needed to lend credence to the notion that genuine progress can be made in this important field.
sentences.cn: 要有优秀的研究才能使人相信在这一重大领域能取得真正的进步。

sentences.en: Her denials of this charge served merely to lend it credence.
sentences.cn: 她对这一指控的矢口否认,反倒更使人相信这一指控是真的.

sentences.en: Her experience lends credence to the adage " We live and learn! "
sentences.cn: 她的经验印证了一句格言: 活到老,学到老!

sentences.en: Historical evidence lends credence to his theory.
sentences.cn: 史学根据使他的理论更为可信。

sentences.en: I attach little credence to what she says.
I do not give much credence to tips obtained at second hand.
sentences.cn: 我对于间接得到的秘密消息不太相信.

sentences.en: Individual credence is the main base that credit builds.
sentences.cn: 个人信用是信用建设的重要基础.

sentences.en: It is an allegation that has gained credence from neutral observers.
sentences.cn: 这一指控得到了中立观察员的认同.

sentences.en: It is strictly forbidden to obtain confessions and to give them credence.
Police attach credence to the report of an unnamed bystander.
sentences.cn: 警方认为一位不知姓名的目击者的报告很有用.

sentences.en: The market economy that devoid credence supports is a disorder necessarily.
sentences.cn: 缺乏信用支撑的市场经济必然陷入混乱.

sentences.en: This sudden storm lends credence to the weatherman's warning.
sentences.cn: 突来的暴风雨看来证实了气象员的警报.

sentences.en: You're surely not giving any credence to this story of Hythe's?
sentences.cn: 你肯定不会相信海斯的说法吧？

words.tran_cn: 信用，信誉；[金融] 贷款；学分；信任；声望
相信，信任；把…归给，归功于；赞颂
信任；凭证；祭器台（等于credence table，credenza）

trans.tran_cn: 相信（传言），凭证，餐具柜，[宗]祭器台
trans.tran_en: the acceptance of something as true
